revised_title: Agricultural Productivity in the 1980s: Substitute Foods and Future Trends
tldr: This article discusses the potential of substitute foods, such as synthetic and reformed alternatives, to meet human nutritional requirements and increase agricultural productivity in the 1980s. It explores various methods of producing synthetic proteins and fats, as well as the challenges and future trends in the food industry. The article also highlights the importance of developing highly acceptable and palatable products to meet consumer demands.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Food Studies
